citations.narrative:
Substances that can be toxic to dogs are currently being stored on open shelves in two areas. Spray bottles of cleaning
chemicals are hung on a shelving unit in the indoor dog housing area just a few feet away from dog enclosures. Bottles
and cans of paint, fly bait, pest sprays and other chemicals are being stored on a shelf above run number 1 in the indoor
portion of the sheltered housing building. These substances may be toxic to dogs if they come in contact with them or
ingest them if the bottles/cans were to fall into or leak into the dog enclosures.
Substances that are toxic to dogs but are required for normal husbandry practices must be stored securely such as in
cabinets if in the animal areas or may be stored outside of the animal housing areas. Correct by 10/21/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Substances that can be toxic to dogs are currently being stored on open shelves in two areas. Spray bottles of cleaning 
chemicals are hung on a shelving unit in the indoor dog housing area just a few feet away from dog enclosures. Bottles 
and cans of paint, fly bait, pest sprays and other chemicals are being stored on a shelf above run number 1 in the indoor 
portion of the sheltered housing building. These substances may be toxic to dogs if they come in contact with them or 
ingest them if the bottles/cans were to fall into or leak into the dog enclosures.  
Substances that are toxic to dogs but are required for normal husbandry practices must be stored securely such as in 
cabinets if in the animal areas or may be stored outside of the animal housing areas. Correct by 10/21/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
